segment.source: MD Conversion - Android configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Android configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Android configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Android configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Use the Android general configuration policy to configure settings for:
segment.target: Use the Android general configuration policy to configure settings for:

segment.source: Mobile device security settings – Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.
segment.target: Mobile device security settings – Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.

segment.source: Kiosk mode (for Samsung KNOX devices only) - Lock a device to only allow certain features to work.
segment.target: Kiosk mode (for Samsung KNOX devices only) - Lock a device to only allow certain features to work.

segment.source: For example, you can allow a device to only run one managed app that you specify, or you can disable the volume buttons on a device.
segment.target: For example, you can allow a device to only run one managed app that you specify, or you can disable the volume buttons on a device.

segment.source: These settings might be used for a demonstration model of a device, or a device that is dedicated to performing only one function, such as a point of sale device.
segment.target: These settings might be used for a demonstration model of a device, or a device that is dedicated to performing only one function, such as a point of sale device.

segment.source: Compliant and noncompliant apps - Specify a list of apps that are compliant, or not compliant in your company.
segment.target: Compliant and noncompliant apps - Specify a list of apps that are compliant, or not compliant in your company.

segment.source: On Android and iOS devices, the Noncompliant Apps Report can be used to view the compliance of apps you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed (but cannot actually block the installation of the app).
segment.target: On Android and iOS devices, the Noncompliant Apps Report can be used to view the compliance of apps you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed (but cannot actually block the installation of the app).

segment.source: You can configure terms and conditions for users to ensure that they acknowledge that apps on their device, including personal apps will be evaluated, and noncompliant apps will either be blocked, or reported as noncompliant.
segment.target: You can configure terms and conditions for users to ensure that they acknowledge that apps on their device, including personal apps will be evaluated, and noncompliant apps will either be blocked, or reported as noncompliant.

segment.source: Users must accept these terms and conditions before they can enroll their device and use the company portal to get apps.
segment.target: Users must accept these terms and conditions before they can enroll their device and use the company portal to get apps.

segment.source: For more information about using terms and conditions, see Working with terms and conditions policies in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about using terms and conditions, see Working with terms and conditions policies in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: To provide basic settings for the configuration policy
segment.target: To provide basic settings for the configuration policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.

segment.source: Click Android > General Configuration and then click Create Policy.
segment.target: Click Android > General Configuration and then click Create Policy.

segment.source: You cannot create a configuration policy using recommended settings.
segment.target: You cannot create a configuration policy using recommended settings.

segment.source: You must create a custom policy.
segment.target: You must create a custom policy.

segment.source: In the General section of the Create Policy page, specify a name and a description for the new policy.
segment.target: In the General section of the Create Policy page, specify a name and a description for the new policy.

segment.source: Use the information in the following sections to help you supply settings for the policy.
segment.target: Use the information in the following sections to help you supply settings for the policy.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Mobile device security policy settings for Android devices
segment.target: Mobile device security policy settings for Android devices

segment.source: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this list, you might be able to create it using an Android custom policy that lets you use OMA-URI settings to control the device.
segment.target: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this list, you might be able to create it using an Android custom policy that lets you use OMA-URI settings to control the device.

segment.source: For more information, see Android custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Android custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Require a password to unlock mobile devices
segment.target: Require a password to unlock mobile devices

segment.source: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped
segment.target: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped

segment.source: Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off
segment.target: Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off

segment.source: Remember password history – Prevent reuse of previous passwords
segment.target: Remember password history – Prevent reuse of previous passwords

segment.source: (allows the device to utilize location information)
segment.target: (allows the device to utilize location information)

segment.source: (allows operations that use near field communication)
segment.target: (allows operations that use near field communication)

segment.source: If this setting is disabled, the setting Number of repeated sign in failures to allow before the device is wiped for Samsung KNOX devices does not function.
segment.target: If this setting is disabled, the setting Number of repeated sign in failures to allow before the device is wiped for Samsung KNOX devices does not function.

segment.source: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps
segment.target: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps

segment.source: In the Compliant & Noncompliant Apps list, specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps using the following information:
segment.target: In the Compliant & Noncompliant Apps list, specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps using the following information:

segment.source: A single policy can only contain a list of compliant, or a list of noncompliant apps.
segment.target: A single policy can only contain a list of compliant, or a list of noncompliant apps.

segment.source: You cannot specify both in the same policy.
segment.target: You cannot specify both in the same policy.

segment.source: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps
segment.target: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps

segment.source: Lists the apps that are not managed by Intune which users are not allowed to install and run.
segment.target: Lists the apps that are not managed by Intune which users are not allowed to install and run.

segment.source: Do not report noncompliance when users install the listed apps
segment.target: Do not report noncompliance when users install the listed apps

segment.source: Lists the apps that users are allowed to install.
segment.target: Lists the apps that users are allowed to install.

segment.source: Users cannot install any other apps.
segment.target: Users cannot install any other apps.

segment.source: Apps that are managed by Intune are automatically allowed.
segment.target: Apps that are managed by Intune are automatically allowed.

segment.source: Adds an app to the selected list.
segment.target: Adds an app to the selected list.

segment.source: Specify a name of your choice, optionally the app publisher, and the URL to the app in the app store.
segment.target: Specify a name of your choice, optionally the app publisher, and the URL to the app in the app store.

segment.source: How to specify URLs to app stores
segment.target: How to specify URLs to app stores

segment.source: Imports a list of apps you have specified in a comma-separated values file.
segment.target: Imports a list of apps you have specified in a comma-separated values file.

segment.source: Use the format, application name, publisher, app URL in the file.
segment.target: Use the format, application name, publisher, app URL in the file.

segment.source: Let’s you edit the name, publisher and URL of the selected app.
segment.target: Let’s you edit the name, publisher and URL of the selected app.

segment.source: Deletes the selected app from the list.
segment.target: Deletes the selected app from the list.

segment.source: Specify the following settings for Samsung KNOX devices:
segment.target: Specify the following settings for Samsung KNOX devices:

segment.source: Select a managed app that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode
segment.target: Select a managed app that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode

segment.source: Click Browse, then select the managed app, or app from a store that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode.
segment.target: Click Browse, then select the managed app, or app from a store that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode.

segment.source: No other apps will be allowed to run on the device.
segment.target: No other apps will be allowed to run on the device.

segment.source: How to specify URLs to app stores
segment.target: How to specify URLs to app stores

segment.source: Enables or disables the use of the volume buttons on the device.
segment.target: Enables or disables the use of the volume buttons on the device.

segment.source: Enables or disables the screen sleep wake button on the device.
segment.target: Enables or disables the screen sleep wake button on the device.

segment.source: Deploy the configuration policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the configuration policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts In the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts In the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: Reference information for compliant and noncompliant apps
segment.target: Reference information for compliant and noncompliant apps

segment.source: Use the Noncompliant Apps Report to view the compliance of allowed and blocked apps.
segment.target: Use the Noncompliant Apps Report to view the compliance of allowed and blocked apps.

segment.source: To run the Noncompliant Apps Report
segment.target: To run the Noncompliant Apps Report

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Reports > Noncompliant Apps Report.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Reports > Noncompliant Apps Report.

segment.source: Select the device groups that you would like to check, whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both, then click View Report.
segment.target: Select the device groups that you would like to check, whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both, then click View Report.

segment.source: How to specify URLs to app stores
segment.target: How to specify URLs to app stores

segment.source: To specify an app URL in the compliant and noncompliant apps list, or in the Select a managed app that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode option (iOS only), use the following format:
segment.target: To specify an app URL in the compliant and noncompliant apps list, or in the Select a managed app that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode option (iOS only), use the following format:

segment.source: In the Apps section of Google Play, search for the app you want to use.
segment.target: In the Apps section of Google Play, search for the app you want to use.

segment.source: Open the installation page for the app, and copy the URL to the clipboard.
segment.target: Open the installation page for the app, and copy the URL to the clipboard.

segment.source: You can now use this as the URL in either the compliant or noncompliant apps list.
segment.target: You can now use this as the URL in either the compliant or noncompliant apps list.

segment.source: Example: Search Google Play for Microsoft Office Mobile.
segment.target: Example: Search Google Play for Microsoft Office Mobile.

segment.source: The URL you use will be https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.office.officehub.
segment.target: The URL you use will be https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.office.officehub.

segment.source: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
